name: Red (Little Red Riding Hood)
traits: Courageous, curious, observant, compassionate, strong-willed, resourceful
background: Lives with her mother near the woods; raised to be cautious yet yearns for independence. Has a close relationship with her grandmother and is determined to prove herself.
motivation: Wants to help her grandmother and demonstrate her maturity; seeks adventure and connection; drawn by her sense of justice and budding feelings toward the Wolf.

name: Wolf
traits: Clever, mischievous, charismatic, vulnerable beneath bravado, impulsive, playful
background: A lone wolf with a reputation for cunning; has lived on the outskirts of human society and is fascinated by Red’s bravery. His actions stem more from curiosity and desire for connection than malice.
motivation: Seeks attention and acceptance; wants to impress Red and win her admiration, initially through trickery but later through genuine amends.

name: Luc (The Woodsman)
role: Deuteragonist; protector and potential romantic rival
traits: Protective, pragmatic, quietly brave, loyal, perceptive, gentle beneath a gruff exterior
background: A young woodsman familiar with the dangers of the forest; knows Red and her family through the local community. Has a growing affection for Red and a sense of duty toward her safety.
motivation: Wants to protect Red from harm and prove his worthiness; conflicted by feelings of jealousy and admiration toward the Wolf.

name: Granny (Red’s Grandmother)
role: Supporting character; catalyst for the story
traits: Wise, nurturing, sly sense of humor, resilient, open-minded
background: Red’s grandmother, living alone in a cottage deep in the woods. Maintains a strong bond with Red and is more perceptive than she appears.
motivation: Cares deeply for Red’s well-being; enjoys a bit of mischief herself; ultimately seeks harmony and understanding between Red, Luc, and the Wolf.

name: Red’s Mother
role: Minor but pivotal character; provider of Red’s mission
background: Red’s mother, raising her daughter with a blend of affection and strictness. Has experienced loss or hardship, leading to her wariness of the woods.
motivation: Desires Red’s safety above all; wants her daughter to learn responsibility while staying out of harm’s way.
